criteria: Appropriateness of Graph Choice and Labels
descriptions: The graph is missing or completely inaccurate, showing no correct representation of the data.
The graph has significant inaccuracies, with data poorly represented and difficult to interpret. Multiple errors are present.
The graph has some inaccuracies in data representation, but the general trend of the data can still be understood. Several errors are present.
The graph is mostly accurate, with only minor errors in data representation. The data is generally easy to interpret. Few errors are present.
The graph is accurate and clearly represents the data, with appropriate labels and scale. The data is easy to interpret and understand. Very few errors are present.
The graph is exceptionally accurate, clear, and insightful. It demonstrates a deep understanding of data representation with appropriate labels, scale, and presentation. No errors are present.
The type of graph is inappropriate for the data, and labels are missing or incorrect.
The type of graph is not ideal for the data, and labels are incomplete or confusing.
The type of graph is acceptable for the data, but labels could be clearer or more informative.
The type of graph is well-suited for the data, and labels are generally clear and informative.
The type of graph is highly effective for the data, with clear, concise, and informative labels.
The type of graph is perfectly suited for the data, enhanced with insightful and detailed labels, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of data visualization principles.
Unable to solve any problems using the information presented in the graph.
Attempts to solve problems are unsuccessful or demonstrate a misunderstanding of the data.
Able to solve very simple problems, but struggles with more complex questions.
Able to solve simple put-together, take-apart, and compare problems with some guidance.
Able to independently solve simple put-together, take-apart, and compare problems using the graph.
Demonstrates a strong ability to solve complex problems and draw insightful conclusions from the data presented in the graph.
